paper_abstract: STRING MATCHING IS A CRITICAL ELEMENT OF MODERN INTRUSION DETECTION SYSTEMS BECAUSE IT LETS A SYSTEM MAKE DECISIONS BASED NOT JUST ON HEADERS, BUT ACTUAL CONTENT FLOWING THROUGH THE NETWORK. THROUGH CAREFUL CODESIGN AND OPTIMIZATION OF AN ARCHITECTURE WITH A NEW STRING MATCHING ALGORITHM, THE AUTHORS SHOW IT IS POSSIBLE TO BUILD A SYSTEM THAT IS ALMOST 12 TIMES MORE EFFICIENT THAN THE CURRENTLY BEST KNOWN APPROACHES.
paper_title: Architectures for bit-split string scanning in intrusion detection
